text: The Ways of the Righteous and the Wicked
Blessed is the man who does not walk in the advice of \add the\add* wicked;
nor does he stand in \add the\add* way of sinners;
nor does he sit in \add the\add* assembly of mockers.
Instead, in the law of Yahweh \add is\add* his delight,
and on his law he meditates day and night.
And so, he is like a tree planted by streams of water
that gives its fruit in its season;
its leaf also does not wither.
Therefore all that he does prospers.
Instead, \add they are\add* like the chaff that \add the\add* wind scatters.
Therefore \add the\add* wicked will not stand in the judgment,
nor sinners in the congregation of \add the\add* righteous;
for Yahweh knows \add the\add* way of \add the\add* righteous,\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Plural \f*
but \add the\add* way of \add the\add* wicked will perish.
